net.lonewolfcode.opensource.springutilities.controllers

Class CrudController

  • java.lang.Object
    • net.lonewolfcode.opensource.springutilities.controllers.CrudController

  • @RestController
public class CrudController
extends java.lang.Object
    The Generic Crud controller class. This class is the meat of this project and does all the magic.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      CrudController(org.springframework.beans.factory.ListableBeanFactory beanLister)
      This constructor gets all classes marked with @CrudRepo and loads them into a map for use later.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void doDeleteStringId(java.lang.String repositoryName, java.lang.String id)
      This deletes a specific entity from the repository.
      WARNING: As of this moment only entities with a single id field that is a string are supported.
      java.util.List<java.lang.Object> doGetAll(java.lang.String repositoryName)
      This gets all instances of the entity that the annotated repository controls and returns them in a list.
      java.lang.Object doGetStringId(java.lang.String repositoryName, java.lang.String id)
      This gets a specific entity from the repository.
      WARNING: As of this moment only entities with a single id field that is a string are supported.
      void doPost(java.lang.String repositoryName, java.lang.String rawJson)
      This posts either a single entity or a list of entities to the specified repository.

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

    • Constructor Detail

      • CrudController

        public CrudController(org.springframework.beans.factory.ListableBeanFactory beanLister)
        This constructor gets all classes marked with @CrudRepo and loads them into a map for use later. This also sets up our jaxson ObjectMapper.
        Parameters:
        beanLister - This parameter is injected by spring and helps us search for annotations. It is only used in this constructor and not stored.
        See Also:
        ObjectMapper, CrudRepo

    • Method Detail

      • doGetAll

        @GetMapping(value="/{repositoryName}")
public java.util.List<java.lang.Object> doGetAll(@PathVariable
                                                                                         java.lang.String repositoryName)
                                                                                  throws NotFoundException
        This gets all instances of the entity that the annotated repository controls and returns them in a list.
        Parameters:
        repositoryName - this path variable is your set basePathName or the name of the repository class if now basePathName was provided.
        Returns:
        A list of all entities controlled by the repository invoked
        Throws:
        NotFoundException - if the path you enter refers to a nonexistent repository or if your CrudRepo annotation is set to disallow this function, this error is thrown.

      • doGetStringId

        @GetMapping(value="/{repositoryName}/{id}")
public java.lang.Object doGetStringId(@PathVariable
                                                                                   java.lang.String repositoryName,
                                                                                   @PathVariable
                                                                                   java.lang.String id)
                                                                            throws NotFoundException
        This gets a specific entity from the repository.
        WARNING: As of this moment only entities with a single id field that is a string are supported. More functionality will be implemented later.
        Parameters:
        repositoryName - this path variable is your set basePathName or the name of the repository class if now basePathName was provided.
        id - the id of the object you wish to find
        Returns:
        the specified entity
        Throws:
        NotFoundException - if the path you enter refers to a nonexistent repository or if your CrudRepo annotation is set to disallow this function, this error is thrown.

      • doPost

        @PostMapping(value="/{repositoryName}")
public void doPost(@PathVariable
                                                            java.lang.String repositoryName,
                                                            @RequestBody
                                                            java.lang.String rawJson)
                                                     throws java.io.IOException,
                                                            NotFoundException
        This posts either a single entity or a list of entities to the specified repository.
        Parameters:
        repositoryName - this path variable is your set basePathName or the name of the repository class if now basePathName was provided.
        rawJson - the raw json string from the request body.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - This is thrown when the request body json has an invalid format.
        NotFoundException - if the path you enter refers to a nonexistent repository or if your CrudRepo annotation is set to disallow this function, this error is thrown.

      • doDeleteStringId

        @DeleteMapping(value="/{repositoryName}/{id}")
public void doDeleteStringId(@PathVariable
                                                                             java.lang.String repositoryName,
                                                                             @PathVariable
                                                                             java.lang.String id)
                                                                      throws NotFoundException
        This deletes a specific entity from the repository.
        WARNING: As of this moment only entities with a single id field that is a string are supported. More functionality will be implemented later.
        Parameters:
        repositoryName - this path variable is your set basePathName or the name of the repository class if now basePathName was provided.
        id - the id of the object you wish to delete
        Throws:
        NotFoundException - if the path you enter refers to a nonexistent repository or if your CrudRepo annotation is set to disallow this function, this error is thrown.
